result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip C. Von Behren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with probation in 15CF2 with the following as conditions:

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

No entry into bars, taverns or any place primarily engaged in the sale of alcohol.

No possession or consumption of alcohol.  Submit to testing of blood, breath or urine at the demand of law enforcement or agent to monitor compliance.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete a 24- or 26-week domestic abuse education class.

Provide 20 hours of uncompensated community service.

Pay restitution with the amount and details held open for 30 days.
Concurrent with: 15CF2

Letter from DOC requesting the Court review sentence credit

Notice of Certification & Notice of Certification and Intent to Send the Amount Due to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue - Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward - No new address found, Unable to resend

15CF2 - Counts 1 and 3; 15CM10, Count 1.  Defendant Phillip C. Von Behren in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def has been revoked from probation; being sent to prison on imposed/stayed Count 5 in 15CF2.  Counsel inform the Court of the parties' agreement for sentencing on the remaining revoked counts.  Def address the Court.

Sentence:

15CM10 - 9 months jail concurrent with prison sentence def is serving/will serve.

15CF2 - Count 1 - 9 months jail concurrent; Count 3 - 90 days concurrent.  Concurrent with Count 5.

Court finds def is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Huber granted.
from Defendant to the Court, in advance of sentencing after revocation hearing 8/16/16
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Phillip C. Von Behren
Current: 1375 4th Street, Fennimore, WI 53809 United States  (Effective: 03-23-2016)
Prior: 27155 Maple Ridge Ln., Richland Center, WI 53581 United States

DA Harper, Def in custody, and Atty. McDougal for 15CF2, 15CF8, and 15CM10.

Counsel advise the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution of these matters.

15CM10 - initial appearance completed.
15CF2 and 15CF8 - prelims waived with colloquies.

Per Atty. M, agreement calls for the def's pleas as follows:

15CM10 - 1 count of mis. theft
15CF8 - 1 counts of felony bail jumping
15CF2 - 1 count (count 1) mis. battery, 1 count (count 3) disorderly conduct, and 1 count (count 5) false imprisonment.  Count 2 was previously dismissed though State has erroneously included it on the information doc filed today; Court confirms that Count 2 was dismissed on Jan. 16, 2015.
Remaining counts to be dismissed.
Per Atty. M, the recommendation of the parties to the Court for sentencing is as follows:
15CF2 - on the felony, 6 year prison sentence with 3 years initial conf. and 3 years ext. sup, imposed/stayed for 3 years probation.  On the mis. battery and dc, recommendation is for 2 years probation with conditions.
15CF8 - on the felony bail jumping, 12 months county jail with credit for time served.
15CM10 - misd. theft, probation 2 years, concurrent with misdemeanors in 15CF2.
Recommended conditions of probation:  AODA/follow through; no bars/taverns; no possession/consumption of alcohol; d.a. class; 20 hrs comm. service; restitution if requested.
Atty. M asks for 1 set of court costs to be imposed in 15CF2 and 26 days credit in 15CF8.

Def pleads no contest to the charges stated.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.

ADA Forehand, Atty. McDougal, and Def address the Court.

Sentence:  
15CF2 - false impris./Count 5 - 6 years WI prison system with 3 years initial conf. and 3 years ext. sup. with Dodge as reception center; this to be imposed/stayed for probation of 3 years
misdemeanors - 2 years probation
1 set of costs imposed
DNA sample to be provided if not already provided; DNA surcharge also ordered (Ct 5)

15CF8 - Count 1/fel. bail jumping - 12 mo county jail (straight sentence) with huber and 26 days credit; jail to begin today.

15CM10 - theft - 2 years probation, concurrent with other probation - costs, no DNA.  Probation starts today.

Conditions:  AODA/follow through; no bars/taverns/est. of primary sale of alcohol; must not possess or consume alcohol; submit to test of blood, breath or urine, on demand by leo or agent to monitor compliance; 24-26 wk d.a. class; 20 hrs uncomp. community service; must pay rest. with that matter held open for 30 days

All other counts dismiss/read-in for purposes of sentencing and restitution.
1 doc filed for 3 cases - stored in 15CF2

ADDRESS INFO for Phillip C. Von Behren
Current: 27155 Maple Ridge Ln., Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 01-16-2015)
Prior: 125 Schmitz Street, Richland Center, WI 53581

No contact with Nathan McBain.  Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.  No bars/taverns or any establishment with primary purpose of sale of alcohol.

15CF2/motion hearing
15CF10/initial on just-filed case

Defendant Phillip C. Von Behren in court with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states that she has not been formally appointed in 15CM10; just received the complaint now in court.

15CM10/initial - Atty. M waives formal reading.  Def has indicated that he thought the just-filed matter was previously subject to no-prosecution.  ADA Forehand states that the charges in the complaint just filed results from a just-completed investigation; notes that the bond was previously dismissed but DA has decided to file on the charges.  ADA states that she had said "Ms. Harper is not filing charges at this time," not that the charges weren't going to be brought.

15CM10 - ADA asks for 1k signature bond with no contact with N McBain; also asks for no drink as part of that bond with test-on-demand requirement; no bars/taverns.  ADA states that, in 15CF2, there is a curfew on the bond; wants clarification that def has to be at his residence during the curfew time, not just that he be "inside."  ADA wants same curfew condition on the 15CM10 signature bond she's requesting.  

Atty. M states that, because of the no contact in 15CF2, Def doesn't have a place to stay; states def is abiding by his curfew, keeping in mind that he also has to report to the jail the following day for another condition; def not driving so has to have help with transportation; for that reason, stays where he has to in order for that to happen.  Atty. M states that the def has been taking medications as prescribed and ordered; in compliance with bond with daily taking/reporting to the sheriff's dept.  

Atty. M asks for modification of the 15CF2 bail; states victim wants to request drop of the no contact condition on that bond; states that, if the Court dropped that no contact, def wouldn't have the issues he's having with where he's residing and the arrangements he's having to make to comply with the other conditions.  ADA Forehand - State "vigorously objects" to Atty. M's request for bond modification.  Arguments presented by both counsel.  Victim address court, asking for deletion of the no contact.  Court denies the modification as requested.  Atty. M argues for curfew condition to be dropped; suggests that, if court wants the curfew, wants to know if it would be acceptable that the def calls the jail every night to tell them where he's at.  Court asks if def can "narrow down the places where he will be ... to three or four places."  Def addresses Court.  Court removes the curfew and leaves all other conditions in effect.  ADA states she wants to be on-the-record in opposition of the curfew removal.  Curfew restriction removed.  Other conditions remain.

15CM10 - Court orders 1k signature bond.  Conditions:  No contact with N McBain.  No possession/consumption of alcohol.  Test on demand.  No bars/taverns.

Adj. initial in 15CM10 set for 2/11 at 2:30.

15CF2/motion hearing:  ADA states she does not object to Atty. M's motion for dismissal of 2nd batter charge/count 2.  Court dismisses Count 2/battery.

Atty. M asks for prelim as next hearing for 15CF2.  Prelim set for 2/11 at 2:30.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
